definition: a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: You are only being examined on this semester's work.
sentences.chinese: 現在只考你在本學期學的課程。

sentences.english: Saturday was the representative work of periodicals of civil literature in early Minguo.
sentences.chinese: 《禮拜六》是民國初年市民文學期刊的代表作。

sentences.english: Way back at the start of the semester when we asked,Why believe in souls?
sentences.chinese: 學期一開始的時候我們研究過爲何要相信靈魂的存在？
學期的班幹部競選也開始了。

sentences.english: In term-time they start work later and finish earlier than anyone else.
sentences.chinese: 在學期時間，他們開始和完成的工作早於任何人。

sentences.english: By the end of last term, we had learned about 2000 English songs.
sentences.chinese: 到上學期期末，我們已經學了約2000個英語歌曲。

sentences.english: Continued from page 3)SCIE Staff Club regularly holds outing trips for staff, usually once each semester.
sentences.chinese: SCIE教工俱樂部每個學期組織一次教工出遊活動。

sentences.english: Sixty-three students participated in this contest.
sentences.chinese: 本學期背誦比賽共有六十三位同學參加。

sentences.english: Last term I took part in a geography research study group.
sentences.chinese: 上學期，我參加了地輿小組的研究性學習。

sentences.english: They published their findings in a recent issue of the Journal of Sexual Medicine.
sentences.chinese: 他們在最近的性醫學期刊中發表了其調查結果。

sentences.english: Further progress in this semester, I want to.
sentences.chinese: 在這個學期裏，我要百尺竿頭，更進一步。

sentences.english: Umm, it was my freshman year. It was the first semester, so I came back.
sentences.chinese: 那時是大一的第一學期。等再開學，

sentences.english: Ater a semester, I yearn to see may parents.
sentences.chinese: 經過一個學期，我渴望見到我爸媽。

sentences.english: But I was, I wasn't able to join this semester
sentences.chinese: 但是我，呃，我這個學期不能參加。

sentences.english: Should I stay on for the next semester?
sentences.chinese: 我下學期還應該呆在這裏嗎？

sentences.english: Full-Semester Refund available within first 2 weeks of Spring Semester.
sentences.chinese: 開學兩周內，可申請一學期全額退款。

definition: foundation of a University or College/school opening/the start of a new term
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
the Great Learning, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1] in Confucianism
to study at the same school/fellow student/classmate/CL:位[wei4],個|个[ge4]
to go to school/to attend school
to enter a school or college/to go to school for the first time as a child
to teach/teaching and learning/education/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]
